title: Bug 12906[Editor Mgmt] If file is already opened in one editor, cannot open in another editor (should give error msg)
description: Bug 12906[Editor Mgmt] If file is already opened in one editor, cannot open in another editor (should give error msg)
OB: When attempting to open a java file that is already opened in the workbench using the 'Open With .. System Editor' option, no action is taken and no warning or error message is displayed.
EB: The workbench should display a warning message informing the user that opening the file in another editor may lead to overwriting changes, and prompt them to confirm if they want to continue. Alternatively, an error message should be displayed instructing the user to close all instances of the file before attempting to open it in another editor.
SR:
1. Make sure you have an associate Windows editor for your java file. If not, go to the file explorer, double click on any java file, and select WordPad or Notepad as the default editor for all java files.
2. In the Java Perspective, right click on the Java file and select 'Open With .. System Editor'.
3. Ensure that a Notepad or WordPad window opens with the java file. Close this window.
4. Go to the Java Perspective and open a java file by simply double clicking on it.
5. Right click on the Java file and select 'Open With .. System Editor'.

Expected result: The workbench should display a warning message informing the user that opening the file in another editor may lead to overwriting changes, and prompt them to confirm if they want to continue. Alternatively, an error message should be displayed instructing the user to close all instances of the file before attempting to open it in another editor.
